sub_title: Partner | Rotterdam Office Director | Europe Structures Lead at Buro Happold, and Lecturer at Delft University of Technology
summary:
Buro Happold:
Buro Happold are an international, integrated consultancy of engineers, consultants and advisers, operating in 30+ locations worldwide, with over 80 partners and 2,400 employees.
For over 40 years we have built a world-class reputation for delivering creative, value-led solutions for an ever challenging world.
As a truly inter-connected community of experts, we value human wellbeing, curiosity, embrace mutual responsibility and genuinely care about the impact and legacy of our work.
____________

Background:
A Structural Engineer ensures that buildings and bridges are built to be strong enough and stable enough to resist all involved structural loads (self-weight, gravity, wind, snow, rain, seismic, earth pressure, temperature, traffic loads, etc.). 

Another key point in the work of a Structural Engineer is to design structures to be stiff enough to not deflect or vibrate beyond acceptable limits. Fatigue may be an important consideration for bridges and other structures which experience a large number of stress cycles over their lifetime. 
Consideration is also given to durability of materials against possible deterioration which may impair performance over the design lifetime. 

Furthermore a Structural Engineer inspects, analyses, designs, plans and researches structural components or systems realised in materials like steel, concrete, timber, aluminium, etc. Technical, economic and environmental concerns are taken into account, as well as aesthetic and social factors.

Specialities: 
Project Director in a multi-disciplinary team designing offices, high-rise, apartments, retail, sports, educational facilities, art centres, hotels and bridges.
____________

Dirk Rinze is a Chartered Engineer through KIVI (with Membership Number 000013) and entitled to use the designation of CEng, which is an internationally recognized professional qualification for engineers. 
A professional qualification as CEng is proof that the engineer is continuously engaged at a high level with personal and professional development, in collaboration with others inside and outside their professional field. 
____________

Dirk Rinze is a Registered Structural Designer in the Netherlands with Membership Number 1488, and therefore entitled to use the designation of RO, representing the highest standard of engineering excellence. 
A Registered Structural Designer has demonstrated proven knowledge and experience and is committed to professional standards and to continuous learning.

profile_positions.description:
Lecturer at the Delft University of Technology - Faculty of Architecture - Architectural Engineering + Technology - Chair of Structural Design.

Subjects:
Earthy (one semester per year):
Design studio Earthy aims to design and engineer earthy building, in particular adobe buildings. The goal is to design buildings that can ideally be built by their prospective inhabitants or users. The use of earthen materials necessitates the knowledge of complex geometry, for example in designing and technical drawing of vaults, domes, and arches in optimal shapes. 
The focus of the course is on the relation between materials, forms, and structures, explored computationally. 

BK6ON6 (two semesters per year): 
Design 6 Graduation project Building Technology, in which the 3rd year BSc students are completing their Bachelor’s programme with a final complex design project.

BK4TE5 (one semester per year):
Building Technology, in which the 2nd year BSc students are analyzing current residential buildings and redesigning the same building with additions and expansions.

BK3TE4 (one semester): 
2nd year BSc students are analyzing a relatively simple building regarding 4 no. engineering disciplines, including Structural Design.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.description:

Subjects:

BK6ON6 (two semesters per year): 
Design 6 Graduation project Building Technology, in which the 3rd year BSc students are completing their Bachelor’s programme with a final complex design project.

BK4TE5 (one semester): 
Building Technology, in which the 2nd year BSc students are analyzing current residential buildings and redesigning the same building with additions and expansions.

BK3TE4 (one semester per year): 
2nd year BSc students are analyzing a relatively simple building regarding 4 no. engineering disciplines, including Structural Design. 

BK1TE2 (one semester): 
Material and Construction, in which the 1st year BSc students are calculating straightforward structure elements of steel, concrete and timber.

volunteer_experiences.description: Board member at Royal Netherlands Society of Engineers (KIVI) - section Building Engineering

Dirk Rinze is member of the KIVI Chartership Committee.

The KIVI Chartership Committee is responsible for the quality assurance of the Chartership program. This includes assessing candidates for Chartered or Incorporated Engineer status, maintaining and improving the standards and procedures of the Chartership qualification, and overseeing the Continuous Professional Development (CPD) framework. Through the committee's efforts, Chartered and Incorporated Engineers are stimulated to continually develop their skills and knowledge and apply them to the benefit of society while maintaining the quality standard of KIVI Chartership throughout their careers.

volunteer_experiences.role: Speaker at Dag van de Constructeur 2021
volunteer_experiences.description:
Embodied Carbon
What can you do to reduce Embodied Carbon in your structural designs?

We all (should) know the impact of Embodied Carbon on the climate and our planet, but how can we as Structural Engineers lead the way and reduce Embodied Carbon?
In this session, I have presented several high-level strategies to reduce Embodied Carbon in structural designs. On the back of several sensitivity studies for concrete, steel and timber structures guidelines are given how and where one can make the difference and reduce Embodied Carbon.

Project:                            Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta, VS
Architect: 	                HOK Architecture, Kansas City 
Constructief ontwerp: 	Buro Happold 
Presentatie: 	                Dirk Rinze Visser, Associate Director | Netherlands Leader, Buro Happold Rotterdam

Het gehele project Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta, VS, is een lust voor het oog, maar met name het als een diafragma te openen dak trekt de aandacht van iedere staalconstructeur! Een drietal innovaties ter achtergrondinformatie:
- Eerste te openen dak ter wereld middels een diafragma
- Grootste scorebord ter wereld in een sportfaciliteit
- Eerste LEED Platinum stadion ter wereld
In de presentatie werd ingegaan op het ontwerpproces en -varianten van deze dakconstructie inclusief wereld’s grootste scorebord (volledig in de dakrand verwerkt), maar ook op de acht te openen panelen die tezamen het diafragma vormen.
De rol van Computational Design kwam kort aan de orde, maar natuurlijk ook de maakbaarheid kreeg de nodige aandacht.

De toehoorder werd geïnspireerd door de mogelijkheden én noodzakelijkheid van Computational Design bij de huidige, extreme architectonische visies, zonder dat daarbij de kernwaarden van construceren naar de achtergrond gedrukt worden. De presentatie duurde ongeveer 20 minuten, inclusief twee animaties (3 minuten), waardoor het eindresultaat van een optimale samenwerking tussen constructeur en architect, inclusief gebruik van de nieuwste technologieën, gevisualiseerd werd.

LEAF International 2020

Panel discussion: Construction challenges in high-rise buildings
Panel members:
- Dirk Rinze Visser, Associate Director, Netherlands Leader, Buro Happold
- Danny Forster, President and Founder, Danny Forster & Architecture
- Roland Bechmann, Managing Director and Partner, Werner Sobek

Topics:
- Combustibility in high rise 
- How to maximise offsite delivery methods 
- What are the challenges when you talk sustainability in high rise? Can tall buildings ever be sustainable? 
- High-rise façade design challenges

Project: City of Dreams in Macau, China
Architect: Zaha Hadid Architects (ZHA)
Constructief ontwerp: Buro Happold 
Presentatie: Dirk Rinze Visser, Associate Director, Buro Happold 

Aan de hand van het gerealiseerde project City of Dreams in Macau – hoogte 160 meter – werd de onmiskenbare waarde van Computational Design toegelicht en benadrukt. Met de uiterst complexe geometrie van Zaha Hadid’s, en naar het later zou blijken, laatste architectonische ontwerp, werd in detail de uitgesproken staalconstructie besproken:
- Hoofddraagconstructie
- Stabiliteit uit kernen en gevelbuis
- Vereenvoudiging van geometrie binnen ZHA’s concept
- Knooppunten in gevelbuis
- Werkmethode tussen architect en ingenieur
De toehoorder raakte geïnspireerd door de mogelijkheden én noodzakelijkheid van Computational Design bij de huidige, extreme architectonische visies, zonder dat daarbij de kernwaarden van construeren naar de achtergrond gedrukt werden. 
Een afsluitende video toonde het eindresultaat van een optimale samenwerking tussen constructeur en architect.

Structural Safety from international perspective:
Hoe ver zijn wij van Genua verwijderd

Hoewel de oorzaak van het instorten van de Morandibrug nog in onderzoek is, kunnen
er wel lessen worden getrokken uit deze catastrofe. Aan de hand van Genua en een
aantal bijna ongelukken in het VK, zal een internationaal perspectief op structurele
veiligheid worden geïllustreerd met voorbeelden uit het verleden, heden en toekomst.

Dirk Rinze spoke on "Engineering abroad and Lessons learnt around the world".

Dirk Rinze has worked with Article 25 on a project in Petionville, Haiti. We were rebuilding a large primary school and hall - both earthquake resistant - as these facilities had been destroyed in the devastating earthquake of January 2010.

volunteer_experiences.description: Guest Design Critic at the Bartlett, University College London: providing individual consults to (design teams of) 2nd, 3rd and 4th year Architecture students with the main focus on Structural Design.

Dirk Rinze has worked (pro bono) on projects in both Hinche and Malte Peralte (Haiti) together with Article 25, a leading UK registered charity. The projects consisted of a small school, and a water and sanitation system.
